commit_message:
Fixes for multiregion scenario tests

In multiregion setup, some of the scenario tests
are failing to get the region information and errors
with endpoints not found or fails to identify the
correct endpoint or uses the first region's endpoint.

The behaviour should be to override the region as defined
in the service specific region config.

The fix applied here is to use a common get_region function
that returns the service_region in context.

Change-Id: I07df17d03aaac24a101282bd2eba884e490eb495
Closes-Bug: #1339733
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/82/105782/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_region(self, service): """ Returns the region for a specific service """ service_region = None for cfgname in dir(CONF._config): # Find all config.FOO.catalog_type and assume FOO is a service. cfg = getattr(CONF, cfgname) catalog_type = getattr(cfg, 'catalog_type', None) if catalog_type == service: service_region = getattr(cfg, 'region', None) if not service_region: service_region = CONF.identity.region return service_region

commit_message:
Drop python-*client from requirements

We don't need python-*client except python-keystoneclient anymore
because of the migrating tempest clients. But python-keystoneclient is
still used in BotoClientBase.

Change-Id: I474d20cd1b4d525ddc67ba37cf8fb1b9b5164d23
Partially implements: bp:tempest-client-scenarios

commit_message:
Add Trove (database) Datastore API Tests

This patchset adds the JSON clients and tests for following
Trove Datastore APIs:

1. list datastores
2. show datastore type
3. list available versions for datastore type
4. show datastore version

Partially implements blueprint: tempest-guest-tests
Change-Id: I7043f080d115089eacf0d00e165e8a383619d1b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/09/87509/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls.db_datastore_ref = CONF.database.db_datastore_ref cls.database_datastores_client = cls.os.database_datastores_client

subject: WIP: Modify BaseComputeTest class for NovaV2.1 API test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-30 04:38:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/bf7305e972c6c7b2443ca1b624cbc7c245369558', 'message': 'Modify BaseComputeTest class for NovaV2.1 API test

This patch adds the support for Nova V2.1 APIs test
in BaseComputeTest.
As Nova V2 and V2.1 APIs are same in term of request and response,
V2.1 tests classes and services client can be shared among those.
Changes-
1. Set the resources for V2.1 tests same as of V2
2. Set the variable api_version on each service client for V2.1 request

Partially implements blueprint nova-v2.1-api-tests

commit_message:
WIP: Modify BaseComputeTest class for NovaV2.1 API test

This patch adds the support for Nova V2.1 APIs test
in BaseComputeTest.
As Nova V2 and V2.1 APIs are same in term of request and response,
V2.1 tests classes and services client can be shared among those.
Changes-
1. Set the resources for V2.1 tests same as of V2
2. Set the variable api_version on each service client for V2.1 request

As a sample, this patch adds the test_attach_interfaces implementation
for Nova V2.1 API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v2.1-api-tests

Change-Id: I8d1fd8d8bba75857ef4125a9fdb90cf4ab118bb6

Pass region information in neutronclient

Fixes ambiguous endpoint errors for tests in multiregion setup.

Change-Id: I19238b907545be32c6a40edfa04c657efbf5edd9
Closes-Bug: #1335924

Uses the fixed_network_name option to select which network
to boot test instances on.  This allows Tempest to be run
in environments where there are multiple networks available.

This does not work with nova-network because from what I can see
there is no way to retrieve the network list right now, but it
will gracefully fall back to the old behavior with nova-network
so I believe that can be left as a future enhancement if someone
needs that functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1250866

Uses the fixed_network_name option to select which network
to boot test instances on.  This allows Tempest to be run
in environments where there are multiple networks available.

This problem does not apply to nova-network environments because
it will happily start instances with multiple networks attached,
so the behavior is left as before in that case.

Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vincent Untz <vuntz@suse.com>

commit_message:
Start instances using fixed network when possible

Uses the fixed_network_name option to select which network
to boot test instances on.  This allows Tempest to be run
in environments where there are multiple networks available.

This problem does not apply to nova-network environments because
it will happily start instances with multiple networks attached,
so the behavior is left as before in that case.

Co-Authored-By: Ben Nemec <bnemec@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vincent Untz <vuntz@suse.com>

Change-Id: Ia78582cac3790653c2281a5b63d953cd46d5c290
Closes-Bug: #1250866

commit_message:
Adds status check for router Port in scenarios

Verifies port status is active (hence, functional),
upon interface addition to a router.
future patches will verify that port status for other events such as
floating IP association and dis-association.

Change-Id: Iad1a61c025161914f323fc032cbc9dfb51838a9a

commit_message:
Track API call success & failures in stress tests

Wrap Client API calls in order to automatically track success and failure
statistics. When exceptions are raised, capture it for later reporting.

Change-Id: I5728748ad81eb40b9d101a0cb0f2eaaa15e6f6ab
Implements: blueprint stress-api-tracking
Co-Authored-By: Walter A. Boring IV <walter.boring@hp.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/49/90449/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.stress import stats self.setUpTracking(stats.Trace()) def setUpTracking(self, trace): """add stats tracking decorator to services.""" if self.manager.servers_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.servers_client) if self.manager.network_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.network_client) if self.manager.limits_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.limits_client) if self.manager.keypairs_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.keypairs_client) if self.manager.quotas_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.quotas_client) if self.manager.flavors_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.flavors_client) if self.manager.floating_ips_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.floating_ips_client) if self.manager.snapshots_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.snapshots_client) if self.manager.volumes_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.volumes_client) if self.manager.volume_types_client: trace.decorate(self.manager.volume_types_client) signal.signal(signal.SIGPIPE, signal.SIG_DFL) # Get the stats singleton for this thread. st = stats.Stats() shared_statistic['stats'] = st.get_stats() if self.stop_on_error and (shared_statistic['fails'] > 0): st.log_stats() st.log_exceptions() if st: st.log_stats() st.log_exceptions() self.tearDown() def run(self): """Run the stress test code.""" raise NotImplementedError()
deleted_lines: if self.stop_on_error and (shared_statistic['fails'] > 1): def run(self): """This method is where the stress test code runs.""" raise NotImplemented()

subject: Enhance templates test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-28 21:44:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/84cf9e0920c2654418e006a77e617a73a2fa6324', 'message': "Enhance templates test

This change adds testing for Heat's template format, with all of the
major supported sections included - AWSTemplateFormatVersion,
Description, Parameters, Mappings, Resources, and Outputs. Each section
has a separate test for both JSON and YAML formats.

Note: several of the templates are written with speed in mind, rather
than real world use. In particular, the IAM::User resource is used
several times with unusual properties. However, launching a stack with
the expected resource (for example perhaps an instance resource) would
slow down the testing considerably, with little benefit to validation
of each section.

Closes-Bug: #1269566
Partial blueprint: tempest-heat-integration

Change-Id: If0d1fea401bfa834816c6f49d7919c19d44813e5

tested - heat_template_version, description, parameter_groups,
parameters, resources, and outputs.

Note: several of the templates are written with speed in mind, rather
than real world use. In particular, the IAM::User resource is used
several times with unusual properties. However, launching a stack with
the expected resource (for example perhaps an instance resource) would
slow down the testing considerably, with little benefit to validation
of each section.

Closes-Bug: #1269566
Partial blueprint: tempest-heat-integration

Change-Id: If0d1fea401bfa834816c6f49d7919c19d44813e5
"}]
commit_message:
Enhance templates test

This change adds testing for Heat's template format, with all of the
major supported sections included - AWSTemplateFormatVersion,
Description, Parameters, Mappings, Resources, and Outputs. Each section
has a separate test for both JSON and YAML formats.

Also, the HOT template format has been added with the following sections
tested - heat_template_version, description, parameter_groups,
parameters, resources, and outputs.

Note: several of the templates are written with speed in mind, rather
than real world use. In particular, the IAM::User resource is used
several times with unusual properties. However, launching a stack with
the expected resource (for example perhaps an instance resource) would
slow down the testing considerably, with little benefit to validation
of each section.

Closes-Bug: #1269566
Partial blueprint: tempest-heat-integration

Change-Id: If0d1fea401bfa834816c6f49d7919c19d44813e5

commit_message:
Adds the test for Resource Group

Creates a Resource group and adds 2 OS::Heat::RandomString resources
verifies the ids of the resources and their values are not null

Change-Id: I50110b1cafa973221194a8c274cc93dcfb9149cd
Closes-Bug: #1324403

Includes 15 out of 54 native resources

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import heatclient.exc as heat_exceptions from tempest import config from tempest.scenario import manager CONF = config.CONF class ResourceTest(manager.OrchestrationScenarioTest): def setUp(self): super(ResourceTest, self).setUp() if not CONF.orchestration.image_ref: raise self.skipException("No image available to test") self.client = self.orchestration_client def launch_stack(self): #set flavor of the nova server that will be created self.parameters = { 'flavor': 'm1.small' } # create the stack self.template = self._load_template(__file__, 'test_kitchensink.yaml') self.stack_name = self._stack_rand_name() self.client.stacks.create( stack_name=self.stack_name, template=self.template, parameters=self.parameters) self.stack = self.client.stacks.get(self.stack_name) self.stack_identifier = '%s/%s' % (self.stack_name, self.stack.id) # delete stack on completion self.stack.delete() self.status_timeout(self.client.stacks, self.stack.id, 'COMPLETE', error_status='FAILED', not_found_exception=heat_exceptions.NotFound) try: self.stack.get() self.assertEqual('DELETE_COMPLETE', self.stack.stack_status) except heat_exceptions.NotFound: pass

Updated telemetry client for bp client-checks-success

Updated the client to handle response status and removed the
response status checks from tests

commit_message:
Network Subnet  API Tests Enhancements

Add test to create a subnet with host route for ipv4
   -Create a subnet with host route
   -Validate the host route after the creation of subnet

Add test to update subnet with the host route for ipv4
   -Create a subnet without host route
   -Update the subnet with the host route
   -Validate the host route updated in the subnet  successfully

Add test to create a subnet with host route for ipv6
   -Create a subnet with host route
   -Validate the host route after the creation of subnet

Add test to update subnet with the host route for ipv6
   -Create a subnet without host route
   -Update the subnet with the host route
   -Validate the host route updated in the subnet  successfully

Change-Id: I45fc94ea7bf2c591dbdbda74485e7028f3f92d38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/04/107404/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_delete_subnet_with_host_route(self): destination = '10.100.1.0/24' nexthop = '10.100.1.10' name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.client.create_network(name=name) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] net_id = network['id'] host_route = {"host_routes": [{"nexthop": nexthop, "destination": destination}]} subnet = self.create_subnet(network, **host_route) # Verify the Subnet created with host route self.assertEqual(subnet['host_routes'], host_route['host_routes']) # Delete subnet and network resp, body = self.client.delete_subnet(subnet['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) # Remove subnet from cleanup list self.subnets.pop() resp, body = self.client.delete_network(net_id) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_update_subnet_with_host_route(self): destination = '10.100.1.0/24' nexthop = '10.100.1.10' name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.client.create_network(name=name) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] net_id = network['id'] subnet = self.create_subnet(network) subnet_id = subnet['id'] host_route = {"host_routes": [{"nexthop": nexthop, "destination": destination}]} # Update the subnet with host route resv, body = self.client.update_subnet(subnet_id, **host_route) updated_subnet = body['subnet'] # Verify the Subnet created with host route self.assertEqual(updated_subnet['host_routes'], host_route['host_routes']) # Delete subnet and network resp, body = self.client.delete_subnet(subnet['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) # Remove subnet from cleanup list self.subnets.pop() resp, body = self.client.delete_network(net_id) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_delete_subnet_with_host_route(self): destination = '2003::0/64' nexthop = '2003::10' name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.client.create_network(name=name) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] net_id = network['id'] host_route = {"host_routes": [{"nexthop": nexthop, "destination": destination}]} subnet = self.create_subnet(network, **host_route) # Verify the Subnet created with host route self.assertEqual(subnet['host_routes'], host_route['host_routes']) # Delete subnet and network resp, body = self.client.delete_subnet(subnet['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) # Remove subnet from cleanup list self.subnets.pop() resp, body = self.client.delete_network(net_id) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_update_subnet_with_host_route(self): destination = '2003::0/64' nexthop = '2003::10' name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.client.create_network(name=name) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) network = body['network'] net_id = network['id'] subnet = self.create_subnet(network) subnet_id = subnet['id'] host_route = {"host_routes": [{"nexthop": nexthop, "destination": destination}]} # Update the subnet with host route resv, body = self.client.update_subnet(subnet_id, **host_route) updated_subnet = body['subnet'] # Verify the Subnet created with host route self.assertEqual(updated_subnet['host_routes'], host_route['host_routes']) # Delete subnet and network resp, body = self.client.delete_subnet(subnet['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) # Remove subnet from cleanup list self.subnets.pop() resp, body = self.client.delete_network(net_id) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status'])

commit_message:
Add multi-provider extension positive test cases

Add positive test cases for:
- mono-segment multi-provider networks
- multi-segment multi-provider networks

Segments used in tests are the ones provided by the option
provider_network_tests.

Multi-provider networks tests reuse the discover mode introduced in
provider network tests.

Change-Id: I51155c80730b1317875b0bab4e4073f7f674d2d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/26/104526/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.ListOpt( 'multiprovider_network_scenario', default=[], help="List segments to use in multi-provider network scenario, " "you can specify: " "0 segment (no test), " "1 segment (test mono-segment network), " "2+ segments (test mono/multi-segment network)."),

commit_message:
Added keystone cli test case

Test case added for below CLIs:-
endpoint-get
role-get

Change-Id: I269cb3d0b4e483707c916dc9aac365f0554b5913
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/85/114885/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_admin_endpoint_get(self): service_type = self.parser.listing(self.keystone('service-list')) for svc in service_type: output = self.parser.listing(self.keystone('endpoint-get', flags='--version', params=svc['type'])) self.assertTableStruct(output, ['Property', 'Value']) def test_admin_role_get(self): roles = self.parser.listing(self.keystone('role-list')) for role in roles: output = self.parser.listing(self.keystone('role-get', params=role['id'])) self.assertTableStruct(output, ['Property', 'Value'])

commit_message:
Add tempest test for heat resource OS::Heat::HARestarter

1.test all the created resources
2.test the "InstanceId" and "AlarmUrl" properties of HARestarter

Change-Id: I15ea6bf0ccf6fa49051f6ce90200084e80ea10cd
Closes-Bug: #1271994
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/51/94551/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 description: Template which creates a HARestarter resource to restart an instance resource parameters: KeyName: description: Name of an existing KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instances type: string resources: WebServerRestartPolicy: type: OS::Heat::HARestarter properties: InstanceId: {Ref: WebServer} HeartbeatFailureAlarm: type: AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm properties: AlarmDescription: Restart the WebServer if we miss a heartbeat MetricName: HeartBeat Namespace: system/linux Statistic: SampleCount Period: '60' EvaluationPeriods: '1' Threshold: '1' AlarmActions: - {Ref: WebServerRestartPolicy} ComparisonOperator: LessThanThreshold WebServer: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: image: cirros-0.3.1-x86_64-uec flavor: m1.small key_name: {get_param: KeyName} outputs: InstanceId: description: the instance ID to be restarted value: {Ref: WebServer} AlarmUrl: description: the signed url to handle the alarm for restarting value: {get_attr: [WebServerRestartPolicy, AlarmUrl]}

Add positive test cases for:
- local provider networks
- flat provider networks
- vlan provider networks
- gre provider networks
- vxlan provider networks

Provider network type to test and associated provider network
specification are defined using the new option
provider_network_scenario:

To test local and vlan provider networks:

    provider_network_scenario=local,vlan:physnet1:1000

To test gre and vxlan provider networks:

    provider_network_scenario=gre:2000,vxlan:3000

'}, {'number': 22, 'created': '2014-09-09 08:24:03.000000000', 'files': ['etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/api/network/admin/test_provider_extension.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4748f2532416372dd5db1f5089b0d12123974475', 'message': 'Add provider extension positive test cases

Add positive test cases for:
- local provider networks
- flat provider networks
- vlan provider networks
- gre provider networks
- vxlan provider networks

Provider network type to test and associated provider network
specification are defined using the new option
provider_network_segments:

To test local and vlan provider networks:

    provider_network_segments=local,vlan:physnet1:1000

To test gre and vxlan provider networks:

    provider_network_segments=gre:2000,vxlan:3000

On one hand, provider_network_segments must be by default empty as
supported network types depend on tested neutron plugin and deployment.
On other hand, the change code must be tested by OpenStack CI and have
a good coverage. That's why when provider_network_segments is empty:
 - we test parse_raw_spec behavior (never called if the option is empty)
 - we test local network type in "discover mode": we skip test if create
   fails with a 400 (error returned if a network type is not supported),
   the test will not be skipped by OpenStack CI as ML2 supports local
   network type.
 - others network types does not support "discover mode" as they require
   deployment dependent attributes.

This change can not use testscenarios because daughter change disallows
to create a provider network and multi-provider network at the same
time so all tests must be in the same testcase.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I419a2ec13c7166130f489e70e7b01e6e2cbb92ce
'}]
commit_message:
Add provider extension positive test cases

Add positive test cases for:
- local provider networks
- flat provider networks
- vlan provider networks
- gre provider networks
- vxlan provider networks

Provider network type to test and associated provider network
specification are defined using the new option
provider_network_segments:

To test local and vlan provider networks:

    provider_network_segments=local,vlan:physnet1:1000

To test gre and vxlan provider networks:

    provider_network_segments=gre:2000,vxlan:3000

On one hand, provider_network_segments must be by default empty as
supported network types depend on tested neutron plugin and deployment.
On other hand, the change code must be tested by OpenStack CI and have
a good coverage. That's why when provider_network_segments is empty:
 - we test parse_raw_spec behavior (never called if the option is empty)
 - we test local network type in "discover mode": we skip test if create
   fails with a 400 (error returned if a network type is not supported),
   the test will not be skipped by OpenStack CI as ML2 supports local
   network type.
 - others network types does not support "discover mode" as they require
   deployment dependent attributes.

This change can not use testscenarios because daughter change disallows
to create a provider network and multi-provider network at the same
time so all tests must be in the same testcase.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I419a2ec13c7166130f489e70e7b01e6e2cbb92ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/98/103498/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Thales Services SAS # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License from tempest.api.network import base from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import config from tempest import exceptions from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF class ProviderExtensionTestMixin(object): NETWORK_TYPE = None @classmethod def get_spec(cls, network_type): for raw_spec in CONF.network.provider_network_scenario: splitted = raw_spec.split(':') try: candidate_type = splitted.pop(0) if candidate_type != network_type: continue spec = {'provider:network_type': network_type} if network_type in ('flat', 'vlan'): spec['provider:physical_network'] = splitted.pop(0) if network_type in ('vlan', 'gre', 'vxlan'): spec['provider:segmentation_id'] = int(splitted.pop(0)) except (IndexError, ValueError): msg = "Failed to parse provider network specification: '%s'" msg %= raw_spec raise cls.failureException(msg) return spec return None @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(ProviderExtensionTestMixin, cls).setUpClass() if not test.is_extension_enabled('provider', 'network'): msg = "provider extension not enabled." raise cls.skipException(msg) cls.spec = cls.get_spec(cls.NETWORK_TYPE) if not cls.spec: msg = "%s provider network support not enabled." msg %= cls.NETWORK_TYPE raise cls.skipException(msg) def safe_create_admin_network(self, **spec): if 'name' not in spec: spec['name'] = data_utils.rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.admin_client.create_network(**spec) network = body['network'] self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) self.addCleanup(self.safe_delete_admin_network, network['id']) return network def safe_delete_admin_network(self, network_id): try: self.admin_client.delete_network(network_id) except exceptions.NotFound: pass def test_create_provider_network(self): observed = self.safe_create_admin_network(**self.spec) self.assertDictContainsSubset(self.spec, observed) def test_update_provider_network(self): network = self.safe_create_admin_network(**self.spec) name = data_utils.rand_name('network-') resp, body = self.admin_client.update_network(network['id'], name=name) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) observed = body['network'] self.assertEqual(network['id'], observed['id']) self.assertEqual(name, observed['name']) self.assertDictContainsSubset(self.spec, observed) def test_delete_provider_network(self): network = self.safe_create_admin_network(**self.spec) resp, body = self.admin_client.delete_network(network['id']) self.assertEqual('204', resp['status']) def test_show_with_provider_attributes(self): network = self.safe_create_admin_network(**self.spec) resp, body = self.admin_client.show_network(network['id']) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) observed = body['network'] self.assertEqual(network['id'], observed['id']) self.assertDictContainsSubset(self.spec, observed) def test_list_with_provider_attributes(self): network = self.safe_create_admin_network(**self.spec) resp, body = self.admin_client.list_networks() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) observeds = body['networks'] for observed in observeds: if observed['id'] == network['id']: self.assertDictContainsSubset(self.spec, observed) class LocalProviderExtensionTestJSON(ProviderExtensionTestMixin, base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): _interface= 'json' NETWORK_TYPE = 'local' class FlatProviderExtensionTestJSON(ProviderExtensionTestMixin, base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): _interface= 'json' NETWORK_TYPE = 'flat' class VlanProviderExtensionTestJSON(ProviderExtensionTestMixin, base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): _interface= 'json' NETWORK_TYPE = 'vlan' class GreProviderExtensionTestJSON(ProviderExtensionTestMixin, base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): _interface= 'json' NETWORK_TYPE = 'gre' class VxlanProviderExtensionTestJSON(ProviderExtensionTestMixin, base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): _interface= 'json' NETWORK_TYPE = 'vxlan' class LocalProviderExtensionTestXML(LocalProviderExtensionTestJSON): _interface= 'xml' class FlatProviderExtensionTestXML(FlatProviderExtensionTestJSON): _interface= 'xml' class VlanProviderExtensionTestXML(VlanProviderExtensionTestJSON): _interface= 'xml' class GreProviderExtensionTestXML(GreProviderExtensionTestJSON): _interface= 'xml' class VxlanProviderExtensionTestXML(VxlanProviderExtensionTestJSON): _interface= 'xml'

commit_message:
Add test for OS::Neutron::Floating* Heat resource

Added a test that checks that OS::Neutron::FloatingIp and
OS::Neutron::FloatingIpAssociation resources are created correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1269569
Change-Id: I1ebf8305b88ca79e9f6a8a9c733fbb7399b13314

{end: 10.0.3.150, start: 10.0.3.20} Router: type: OS::Neutron::Router properties: name: NewRouter admin_state_up: true external_gateway_info: network: {get_param: ExternalNetworkId} enable_snat: true RouterInterface: type: OS::Neutron::RouterInterface properties: router_id: {get_resource: Router} subnet_id: {get_resource: Subnet} Port: type: OS::Neutron::Port properties: name: NewPort network_id: {get_resource: Network} FloatingIP: type: OS::Neutron::FloatingIP properties: floating_network_id: {get_param: ExternalNetworkId} port_id: {get_resource: Port} depends_on: RouterInterface PortToAssociate: type: OS::Neutron::Port properties: name: NewPortToAssociate network_id: {get_resource: Network} FloatingIPToAssociate: type: OS::Neutron::FloatingIP properties: floating_network_id: {get_param: ExternalNetworkId} FloatingIPAssociation: type: OS::Neutron::FloatingIPAssociation properties: floatingip_id: {get_resource: FloatingIPToAssociate} port_id: {get_resource: PortToAssociate} Server: type: OS::Nova::Server metadata: Name: SmokeServerNeutron properties: image: {get_param: ImageId} flavor: {get_param: InstanceType} key_name: {get_param: KeyName} networks: - commit_message:
Show stack traces from tearDowns on tempest.log

This add a LOG.exception call so we can log exceptions from tearDownClass
when the rest of flow is fine (setupClass and test succeeds but tearDownClass
doesn't).

Change-Id: If3755d1f0c680864db34c2e80a2973b6de9763da
Closes-Bug: #1382093

commit_message:
Only check for 1 error code on image meta limit test

This commit removes the check for deprecated behavior on
test_max_image_meta_exceed_limit(). The test must have been added
before the rules in tempest around changing api responses became more
stringent and thus to facilitate a breaking api change 2 checks were
added. However, we should only except the current expected error code
as valid to prevent the invalid behavior from slipping back.

Change-Id: Ia5d46163fc1f52d5bc4a9296b8d1e5692d09fc71

commit_message:
Adding test suite to cover dvr scneario testing

This is the first commit of this test suite.
Currenly it only contains a very simple test
but more complex tests will be added once
the pre-requisites for tempest testing are worked out
See file for detail test description

new test added in this commit: test_explicit_router_creation

Change-Id: If8e275c2d4ac4e36355b139c82e43735d70dd595
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/61/132361/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 OpenStack Foundation # Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import config from tempest import exceptions from tempest.openstack.common import log as logging from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest.services.network import resources as net_resources from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class TestNetworkDvr(manager.NetworkScenarioTest): """ This smoke test suite verifies the following functionality for DVR - Explicit creation of a DVR router, using distributed flag = true - Explicit creation of a CVR router, using distributed flag = false TODO -- It will eventually: -Verify subnets can be attached to the DVR and CVR -Verify subnets can be moved from DVR to CVR and viceversa -Verify that vms attached to subnets can reach each other after regardless of the order in which the network objects are created. For example, first create router then attach subnets then attach vms or first create router, attach vms, then attach subnets, etc... """ @classmethod def check_preconditions(cls): super(TestNetworkDvr, cls).check_preconditions() @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(TestNetworkDvr, cls).resource_setup() for ext in ['router', 'dvr']: if not test.is_extension_enabled(ext, 'network'): msg = "%s extension not enabled." % ext raise cls.skipException(msg) # The check above will pass if api_extensions=all, which does # not mean dvr extensio itself is present. # Instead, we have to check weather dvr is actually present by using # admin credentials to create router with distributed=True attribute # and checking for BadRequest exception and that the resulting router # is has distributed = True set. client = cls.admin_manager.network_client tenant_id = client.rest_client.tenant_id try: _, result = client.create_router(name="pretest-check", admin_state_up=True, tenant_id=tenant_id, distributed=True) router = net_resources.DeletableRouter(client=client, **result['router']) if router.distributed is not True: msg = ("Could not create a distributed router using admin \ credentials and distributed=True attribute. DVR possibly \ NOT enabled") raise cls.skipException(msg) except exceptions.BadRequest: msg = ("Could not create a distributed router using admin \ credentials and distributed=True attribute. DVR possibly \ NOT enabled") raise cls.skipException(msg) def setUp(self): super(TestNetworkDvr, self).setUp() # We need a function to create a router using admin credentials def _create_router_as_admin(self, client=None, tenant_id=None, namestart='router-smoke', distributed=None): if not client: client = self.admin_manager.network_client if not tenant_id: tenant_id = client.rest_client.tenant_id name = data_utils.rand_name(namestart) if not distributed: _, result = client.create_router(name=name, admin_state_up=True, tenant_id=tenant_id) else: _, result = client.create_router(name=name, admin_state_up=True, tenant_id=tenant_id, distributed=distributed) router = net_resources.DeletableRouter(client=client, **result['router']) self.assertEqual(router.name, name) if distributed: self.assertEqual(router.distributed, distributed) self.addCleanup(self.delete_wrapper, router.delete) return router @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.services('network') def test_explicit_router_creation(self): """ Test uses administrative credentials to creates a DVR (Distributed Virtual Routing) router using the distributed=True flag and a CVR (Centralized Virtual Routing) router using the distributed=False flag Acceptance tests: The routers are inclusively created and the distributed flag is set to true for the DVR router and to false for the CVR router. """ self._create_router_as_admin(distributed=True) self._create_router_as_admin(distributed=False)

commit_message:
quota testcases use tenanat_name should use tenanat_id

Test case related to quota usage (test_show_quota_usage)
uses tenant name, ideally it should use tenant id as quota
requires UUID of tenant and not tenant name.

Change-Id: I457addde91cfb7e8d2602bafb67828e4d9280b73
Closes-Bug: #1321617

subject: Allow to customize volume type extra specs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-03 12:17:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/56f121fcc40d34d3e25c916e7c11b771882d6e82', 'message': "Add coraid_repository_key config variable

The Cinder Coraid driver uses type keys to associate with the Storage
Repository by storing FQRN of the repository in 'coraid_repository_key'
key [1].

Therefore, the
test_create_get_delete_volume_with_volume_type_and_extra_specs test
fails as it creates a new volume type and uses it for the new volume
creation. And as this new volume type doesn't have coraid_repository_key
specified, the volume creation fails.

Fix that by introducing the 'coraid_repository_key' config variable and
passing its value as volume extra specs.

1:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/coraid_creating_associating_volume_type.html

Change-Id: I667eb0b63f14010ae8410c17f48f67cd2ada0825
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-03 13:44:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/883e3f5cc37d05f4cf210a6ba6535c23c3744c2f', 'message': "Add coraid_repository_key config variable

Repository by storing FQRN of the repository in 'coraid_repository_key'
key [1].

Therefore, the
test_create_get_delete_volume_with_volume_type_and_extra_specs test
fails as it creates a new volume type and uses it for the new volume
creation. And as this new volume type doesn't have coraid_repository_key
specified, the volume creation fails.

Fix that by introducing the 'coraid_repository_key' config variable and

1:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/coraid_creating_associating_volume_type.html

Change-Id: I667eb0b63f14010ae8410c17f48f67cd2ada0825
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-09-03 13:52:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4cb6326113bf90068a55d597d03bc03d83d20366', 'message': "Add coraid_repository_key config variable

The Cinder Coraid driver uses type keys to associate with the Storage
Repository by storing FQRN of the repository in 'coraid_repository_key'
key [1].

Therefore, the
test_create_get_delete_volume_with_volume_type_and_extra_specs test
fails as it creates a new volume type and uses it for the new volume
creation. And as this new volume type doesn't have coraid_repository_key
specified, the volume creation fails.

Fix that by introducing the 'coraid_repository_key' config variable and
passing its value as volume extra specs.

1:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/coraid_creating_associating_volume_type.html

Change-Id: I667eb0b63f14010ae8410c17f48f67cd2ada0825
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-05 09:09:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/6d6594f7f305fbfaa9e03ba997a36203df707b57', 'message': 'Allow to customize volume type extra specs

Currently, when creating new volume types in tests, Tempest specifies
extra specs with fields "storage_protocol" and "vendor_name" that could
be specified in the config file in the "[volume]" section.

However, for the Cinder Coraid driver is not enough. It uses uses type keys to
associate with the Storage Repository by storing FQRN of the repository in
'coraid_repository_key' key [1].

Therefore, the
test_create_get_delete_volume_with_volume_type_and_extra_specs test
fails as it creates a new volume type and uses it for the new volume
creation. And as this new volume type doesn't have coraid_repository_key
specified, the volume creation fails because the Coraid driver does not
know what repository to use.

Fix that by allowing to pass a custom set of volume type extra specs by
specifying a dictionary with key/value pairs.

1:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/coraid_creating_associating_volume_type.html

Change-Id: I667eb0b63f14010ae8410c17f48f67cd2ada0825
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-17 10:51:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/8bf55286ac52ceb5b5a51c1d1d9a14b2602a67eb', 'message': 'Allow to customize volume type extra specs

commit_message:
Allow to customize volume type extra specs

Currently, when creating new volume types in tests, Tempest specifies
extra specs with fields "storage_protocol" and "vendor_name" that
could be specified in the config file in the "[volume]" section.

However, for the Cinder Coraid driver is not enough. It uses uses
type keys to associate with the Storage Repository by storing FQRN
of the repository in 'coraid_repository_key' key [1].

Therefore, the
test_create_get_delete_volume_with_volume_type_and_extra_specs test
fails as it creates a new volume type and uses it for the new volume
creation. And as this new volume type doesn't have
coraid_repository_key specified, the volume creation fails because
the Coraid driver does not know what repository to use.

Fix that by allowing to pass a custom set of volume type extra specs
by specifying a dictionary with key/value pairs.

1:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/coraid_creating_associating_volume_type.html

Change-Id: I667eb0b63f14010ae8410c17f48f67cd2ada0825
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/19/118619/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('coraid_repository_key', default='', help='FQRN for the coraid storage repository'),

commit_message:
Add tests to iscsi_deploy.build_deploy_ramdisk_options

The build_deploy_ramdisk_options() from the iscsi_deploy.py module had
no unittests, this patch is adding it.

Also this patch simplify a little the tests for
the pxe.build_pxe_config_options() by mocking
iscsi_deploy.build_deploy_ramdisk_options().

Change-Id: I7422027f8d65541cd4ca28b11df1d2a219152b88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/97/139097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ironic.common import keystone def _test_build_deploy_ramdisk_options(self, mock_alnum, api_url): fake_key = '0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUV' fake_disk = 'fake-disk' self.config(disk_devices=fake_disk, group='pxe') mock_alnum.return_value = fake_key expected_opts = {'iscsi_target_iqn': 'iqn-%s' % self.node.uuid, 'deployment_id': self.node.uuid, 'deployment_key': fake_key, 'disk': fake_disk, 'ironic_api_url': api_url} opts = iscsi_deploy.build_deploy_ramdisk_options(self.node) self.assertEqual(opts, expected_opts) mock_alnum.assert_called_once_with(32) # assert deploy_key was injected in the node self.assertIn('deploy_key', self.node.instance_info) @mock.patch.object(keystone, 'get_service_url') @mock.patch.object(utils, 'random_alnum') def test_build_deploy_ramdisk_options(self, mock_alnum, mock_get_url): fake_api_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:6385' self.config(api_url=fake_api_url, group='conductor') self._test_build_deploy_ramdisk_options(mock_alnum, fake_api_url) # As we are getting the Ironic api url from the config file # assert keystone wasn't called self.assertFalse(mock_get_url.called) @mock.patch.object(keystone, 'get_service_url') @mock.patch.object(utils, 'random_alnum') def test_build_deploy_ramdisk_options_keystone(self, mock_alnum, mock_get_url): fake_api_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:6385' mock_get_url.return_value = fake_api_url self._test_build_deploy_ramdisk_options(mock_alnum, fake_api_url) # As the Ironic api url is not specified in the config file # assert we are getting it from keystone mock_get_url.assert_called_once_with()

commit_message:
Remove duplicate HEAT_CFN_IMAGE_URL assignment

There are two places were the URL is assigned within stackrc.
It is impossible to override one of the assignments from localrc.
We want to be able to override it because, in our case, we can not
use https to retrieve the image.

With this commit we allow the URL to be configured and remove
redundant assignment.

Change-Id: I8e5ae77644cec2b87185d740505bc2bbce9c89ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/61/131161/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: HEAT_CFN_IMAGE_URL=${HEAT_CFN_IMAGE_URL:-"https://download.fedoraproject.org/pub/alt/openstack/20/x86_64/Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda.qcow2"} if ! [[ "$IMAGE_URLS" =~ "$HEAT_CFN_IMAGE_URL" ]]; then IMAGE_URLS+=",$HEAT_CFN_IMAGE_URL"

OFAgent: Factor out switch implementation dependent code to sub-drivers

Change-Id: Iba22bea41d289077caa0a2f23bb0428e47e95f5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/36/130136/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================================= OFAgent: Factor out switch implementation dependent code to sub-drivers ======================================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/ofagent-sub-driver Problem Description =================== while ofagent aims to support plain openflow switches, some necessary operations like tunnel port creation is not covered by standards (yet?) and thus will be switch implementation dependent for the foreseeable future. Proposed Change =============== - factor out OVS-dependent code into a sub-driver. - introduce an option to specify a sub-driver. its default will be OVS. Alternatives ------------ none Data Model Impact ----------------- none REST API Impact --------------- none Security Impact --------------- none Notifications Impact -------------------- none Other End User Impact --------------------- none Performance Impact ------------------ none Other Deployer Impact --------------------- none Developer Impact ---------------- none Community Impact ---------------- none Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: yamamoto Other contributors: kakuma Work Items ---------- see "Proposed Change" section. Dependencies ============ none Testing ======= Tempest Tests ------------- none Functional Tests ---------------- none API Tests --------- none Documentation Impact ==================== User Documentation ------------------ none Developer Documentation ----------------------- none References ========== none

commit_message:
ofagent-flow-based-tunneling

Change-Id: I183c2933ddd8581ca8cc28f12cbb3f0ec696669a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/57/128557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= OFAgent: Flow-based tunneling ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/ofagent-flow-based-tunneling make ofagent use flow-based tunneling rather than the current port-based tunneling. Problem description =================== ofagent creates tunnel ports for each peer nodes. It's unscalable and complex. Proposed change =============== use flow-based tunneling, using tun_ipv4_src/tun_ipv4_dst NXMs. Note: while the use of NXMs contradicts to the one of goals of ofagent, i.e. being portable to other switch implementations, it isn't a problem right now because: - the tunneling support is OVS-dependent anyway - i've heard that the future versions of OpenFlow aims to the same direction Alternatives ------------ none Data model impact ----------------- none REST API impact --------------- none Security impact --------------- none Notifications impact -------------------- none Other end user impact --------------------- none Performance Impact ------------------ none Other deployer impact --------------------- none Developer impact ---------------- none Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: yamamoto Other contributors: kakuma Work Items ---------- * add remote_ip=flow support to ovs_lib * tweak ofagent flows accordingly Dependencies ============ none Testing ======= * unit tests * existing third party testing * ideally, multi-node testing is necessary Documentation Impact ==================== none References ========== none

commit_message:
create and use RABBIT_USERID instead of 'guest'.

Newer versions of rabbitmq (3.3 and later) do not allow the 'guest'
user to access on non-local interfaces.

Add the RABBIT_USERID configuration variable, which defaults to 'stackrabbit'.
Create and use that user instead of using the default 'guest'.

Closes-Bug: #1343354
Change-Id: I7f4e5aedc41f21d06b783a1faeb3e2552051032f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/79/107779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RABBIT_USERID=${RABBIT_USERID:-stackrabbit}

As Horizon now defaults to using the _member_ role, automatically
created by Keystone, there is no need to create a Member role.

This commit disables the creation of this additional role and modifies
the remaining dependencies on the Member role within devstack to use
_member_.

tenant are automatically given the _member_ role in that tenant, manual
inititiation of the role add command to explicitly add the role is
also no longer required.

Additionally as all users who are created with an association to a
tenant are automatically given the _member_ role in that tenant, manual
inititiation of the role add command to explicitly add the role is
also no longer required.

Conflicts:
	lib/keystone
	lib/tempest

Change-Id: I29af9fb5dc52bc0af57509c1c0fed2345231f649
Closes-Bug: #1330132
'}]
commit_message:
Use "_member_" role instead of "Member"

As Horizon now defaults to using the _member_ role, automatically
created by Keystone, there is no need to create a Member role.

This commit disables the creation of this additional role and modifies
the remaining dependencies on the Member role within devstack to use
_member_.

Additionally as all users who are created with an association to a
tenant are automatically given the _member_ role in that tenant, manual
inititiation of the role add command to explicitly add the role is
also no longer required.

Conflicts:
	lib/keystone
	lib/tempest

Change-Id: I29af9fb5dc52bc0af57509c1c0fed2345231f649
Closes-Bug: #1330132
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/01/100101/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: openstack role add _member_ --project $1 --user $2

commit_message:
Reorder network creation and Neutron agent startup

Due to a dependency in lib/neutron it is necessary to run the network
creation prior to agent startup.
This is safe as when the agents start, they will pick up their messages
from the queue

Closes-Bug: #1326484
Change-Id: Ic940ff49ded0a9ce30888c087be7c7de7d7e6b36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/99/97999/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is done prior to starting the agents due to a dependency # It is safe to start the agents after the network is setup # as the agents will pickup their messages from the queuesif is_service_enabled neutron; then start_neutron_agents fi
deleted_lines: if is_service_enabled neutron; then start_neutron_agents fi # Once neutron agents are started setup initial network elements

commit_message:
Add mgmt API for datastores

Implemented mgmt API calls for create/update datastores/versions.
To access this API call "admin" role is required.
Removed datastores related commands from trove-manage.
Changed response from datastore-list, now non-administrative user can see only
those datastores which have at least one active version.

Partially implements: blueprint datastores-mgmt-api

Depends-On: I01c0ecc276a73fbbc06ec39bfaa1c66f47fc3a9c Trove
Depends-On: Iee7ed7b141548ef64231acad6319e769d356b97f python-troveclient
Depends-On: I6d57f7e65c9b3e86abdbf5dae10647ea62f8fccc python-troveclient

Change-Id: Ia8ba15ff06c47cb46d68472b336b8ffc1a5e9722

commit_message:
Fix specifying a wrong password in creating swift user

Current version of devstack cannot create user with a specific
password defined for a user. This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I5733d1c81f9011508994d07fa83d4eae7d63279e
Closes-Bug: 1294879

added_lines: eval SPECIFIC_UPASSWORD="\$${user_name^^}_PASSWORD"

commit_message:
Use SERVICE_HOST for heat apis in keystone endpoints

When specifying SERVICE_HOST, I noticed in the keystone catalog that the heat
entries were not using the specified host like the other services did.

Change-Id: I23273a67a8f05afd35506565d33bf892aa69f675

commit_message:
Adds a configure item for public bridge setting

This patch adds a configure item so that we can choose not to
set the gateway IP on public bridge. It will allow to use external
gateway as the floating IPs' exit.

Change-Id: I4874b5b88bc63a0cf429ac2d0725081269059290
Closes-bug: 1339982

commit_message:
Adds more fine grained authentication for setup.

This change adds the ability to set different user passwords, as well
as database user and passwords, for each openstack service. The
former is set by setting {SERVICE_NAME}_PASSWORD in local.conf. The
latter is set by setting {SERVICE_NAME}_DB{USER|PASSWORD} in
local.conf.

If these variables are not set, then the database passwords and users
default to $DATABASE_USER and $DATABASE_PASSWORD, while the passwords
default to $SERVICE_PASSWORD.

For instance, if I wanted the nova user have 'novapassword' as a
password, I would set NOVA_PASSWORD=novapassword in local.conf.
Similarly, if I wanted Nova to use 'novadbuser:novadbpassword' to
login to the database, I would set NOVA_DBUSER=novadbuser and
NOVA_DBPASSWORD=novadbpassword in local.conf.

This is implemented by reading in the values of
{SERVICE_NAME}_PASSWORD and {SERVICE_NAME}_DB{USER,PASSWORD} when the
install_{SERVICE_NAME} functions are called in the setup scripts.

Note that the openstack services supported are:
Nova, Neutron, Keystone, Glance, Swift, Heat, Ceilometer, Cinder

All other addons (E.g. opendaylight) default to
$DATABASE_{USER,PASSWORD} and $SERVICE_PASSWORD

Change-Id: I6ac35ade270b5b88cb688a2e8df3faac088fec92
Closes-bug: #1353752

commit_message:
Allow devstack to configure multiple private networks

This is a change to support testing of the Tempest functionality
for running in environments with multiple available networks.  It
defaults to disabled to not break any existing environments, but
once the Tempest change has merged it could be enabled in one of
the Tempest gate tests.

Note that this currently only applies to Neutron.

In order to tell devstack to create the extra network, set
Q_CREATE_EXTRA_NETWORK=True in localrc.

Change-Id: I7a17b887dc22c4fda6c4feafecd34430ad2ffb7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/69/69769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create an extra network for testing Tempest Q_CREATE_EXTRA_NETWORK=${Q_CREATE_EXTRA_NETWORK:-False} if [[ "$Q_CREATE_EXTRA_NETWORK" == "True" ]]; then neutron net-create --tenant-id $TENANT_ID "extra-private" fi

commit_message:
neutron/service-agent: support consolidated service agent

This patch is devstack support for l3-agent-consolidation of Neutron.
New configuration variables are introduced.
q-svc-agt: service name of new consolidated agent
Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS: comma separated list of service name to consolidate
NOTE:For now lbaas_haproxy agent can't be consolidated because of
periodic_interval. So it's run as a single binary.

e.g.
enable_service q-svc-agt
Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS="q-dhcp,q-l3,q-metering,q-lbaas,q-vpn"

Implements: blueprint l3-agent-consolidation
Change-Id: Iac48a157fc58513cc0f0277f51dae76478bfb203

added_lines: # Neutron consolidated service agent # ---------------------------------- # Save trace setting MY_XTRACE=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace # TODO(yamahata): enable by default when confident #Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS=${Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS:-"q-dhcp,q-fwaas,q-metering,q-lbaas,q-vpn"} Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS=${Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS:-""} Q_SERVICE_AGENT_CONF_FILE=${NEUTRON_CONF_DIR}/service_agent.ini AGENT_SERVICE_BINARY="$NEUTRON_BIN_DIR/neutron-service-agent" declare -A _DRIVER_ENTRY_POINT _DRIVER_ENTRY_POINT[q-dhcp]="dhcp" _DRIVER_ENTRY_POINT[q-l3]="l3" _DRIVER_ENTRY_POINT[q-lbaas]="lbaas_haproxy" _DRIVER_ENTRY_POINT[q-metering]="metering" _DRIVER_ENTRY_POINT[q-vpn]="vpn" function neutron_use_consolidate_agent() { [[ ,$Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS, =~ ,$1, ]] } function _use_consolidate_agent() { for service in "${Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS//,/ }"; do if is_service_enabled $service; then return 0 fi done return 1 } function neutron_agnet_service_configure_agent() { if _use_consolidate_agent; then cp $NEUTRON_DIR/etc/service_agent.ini $Q_SERVICE_AGENT_CONF_FILE fi for service in ${Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS//,/ }; do if is_service_enabled $service; then iniadd $Q_SERVICE_AGENT_CONF_FILE service_agent device_driver ${_DRIVER_ENTRY_POINT[$service]} fi done } function neutron_service_agent_stop() { pids=$(ps aux | awk '/${SERVICE_AGENT_BINARY}/ { print $2 }') [ ! -z "$pids" ] && sudo kill $pids } # Restore xtrace $MY_XTRACE

Add pxebin location for SUSE

This patch checks if the system running a SUSE based distribution and sets
the path where pxelinux.0 is.

Change-Id: Iba39cedbde7736f2647778dfc8107ac4f2c36b64

commit_message:
Fix check path of pxebin when variable isn't set

This patch fixes the case where devstack is configured to install
ironic and the host OS isn't supported.

Here is an example script to illustrate that the validation fails when $pxebin
is not set:

$ cat > test.sh <<EOF
touch /tmp/foo
test -f /tmp && echo "/tmp/foo is a file"
test -f $bar && echo "This shouldn't be printed"
test -f "$bar" && echo "This isn't printed"
bar=/tmp/foo
test -f "$bar" && echo "this is OK"
EOF
$ bash -x test.sh
+ touch /tmp/foo
+ test -f /tmp
+ test -f
+ echo 'This shouldn'\''t be printed'
This shouldn't be printed
+ test -f ''
+ bar=/tmp/foo
+ test -f /tmp/foo
+ echo 'this is OK'
this is OK

Change-Id: Idaf377b8bf092d631bf77522af570faf2b47252a
Closes-Bug: 1356946
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/77/114277/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ ! -f "$pxebin" ]; then

commit_message:
An example of Certificate Generation with devstack

This uses the in-built CA generator rather than certmonger because
1. As far as i can see certmonger will ONLY issue self-signed unless
   attached to an external CA.
2. I would have then had to figure out how to make sure the certmonger
   process was up and running before requesting.

However the basic process is the same. In the event that you don't get
the certificates you expect for an enabled cert then you should generate
some new ones. Whether we used the inbuilt OpenSSL or Certmonger is then
just figuring out how to do that abstraction in bash.

Because we just set the environment variables that the rest of devstack
expects the whole thing will work in much the same way as the user
inputted variables.

Change-Id: I3a80481743541822581e694cd6c37d4b49e43b6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/26/47526/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $cert && $key && $ca ]]; then cat $ca >> $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE else if [[ ! $CERT_GEN_INITIALIZED ]]; then rm -rf $INT_CA_DIR rm -rf $ROOT_CA_DIR init_CA cat $INT_CA_DIR/ca-chain.pem >> $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE CERT_GEN_INITIALIZED=1 fi make_cert $INT_CA_DIR $service $HOST_IP declare -g $cert_var=$INT_CA_DIR/$service.crt declare -g $key_var=$INT_CA_DIR/private/$service.key declare -g $ca_var=$INT_CA_DIR/ca-chain.pem fi
deleted_lines: if [[ !($cert && $key && $ca) ]]; then die $LINENO "Missing either the ${cert_var} ${key_var} or ${ca_var}" \ "variable to enable SSL for ${service}" fi # [[ $ca ]] && ! grep -Fxqf $ca $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE && cat $ca >> $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE cat $ca >> $SSL_BUNDLE_FILE

Use a consistent q-l3 screen name for Neutron L3 services

The changing title of the screen for L3 was confusing to users.  This
change unifies the name regardless of which variant of L3 is executed.

commit_message:
Add parameter to configure number of Nova workers

DevStack was setting Nova to load four workers per each Nova service as
CI envs run on four CPU cores, according to comment in
I09f4c6f57e71982b8c7fc92645b3ebec12ff1348.

Later on in Id8009b5fd37cef03ca66cb5bf44211039ac895ba Nova was added
with detection of the number of cores available.

The memory consumption taken by each worker can be considerably
high specially on low-end development environments.

This patch introduces the NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER configuration parameter
where users can adjust the number of workers Nova should load.

Change-Id: I3648ff76a8e14b6abd85a2904df5eb4bc31e47ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/55/95355/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Number of worker threads for each Nova service NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER=${NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER:-4} iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT osapi_compute_workers "$NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER" iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT ec2_workers "$NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER" iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT metadata_workers "$NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER" iniset $NOVA_CONF conductor workers "$NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER"
deleted_lines: iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT osapi_compute_workers "4" iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT ec2_workers "4" iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT metadata_workers "4" iniset $NOVA_CONF conductor workers "4"

commit_message:
[WIP] Change output of worlddump to stdout instead of file by default

Now, worlddump writes out a log file to the current directory by
default. However, it seems wrong behaviour.

Change-Id: I2d8b775a0159d390c1f0afd2b18ffd6924e96383

deleted_lines: default='.', fname = filename(opts.dir) print "World dumping... see %s for details" % fname sys.stdout = os.fdopen(sys.stdout.fileno(), 'w', 0) with open(fname, 'w') as f: os.dup2(f.fileno(), sys.stdout.fileno())

commit_message:
makes openflow version configurable

Change-Id: Iec0ab9d8a5c25e1c254b755ab4c5791be0b337e7
Closes-Bug: 1338469
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/90/105090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ODL_OF_VERSION=${ODL_OF_VERSION:-"1.3"} if [ "$ODL_OF_VERSION" == "1.3" ]; then # Configure OpenFlow 1.3 echo "ovsdb.of.version=1.3" >> $ODL_DIR/opendaylight/configuration/config.ini else echo "ovsdb.of.version=1.1" >> $ODL_DIR/opendaylight/configuration/config.ini fi OF_ARG="-of13" if [ "$ODL_OF_VERSION" != "1.3" ]; then OF_ARG="" fi screen_it odl-server "cd $ODL_DIR/opendaylight && JAVA_HOME=$JHOME ./run.sh $ODL_ARGS $OF_ARG -virt ovsdb"
deleted_lines: # Configure OpenFlow 1.3 echo "ovsdb.of.version=1.3" >> $ODL_DIR/opendaylight/configuration/config.ini screen_it odl-server "cd $ODL_DIR/opendaylight && JAVA_HOME=$JHOME ./run.sh $ODL_ARGS -of13 -virt ovsdb"

commit_message:
TESTING: Add secondary mirror for ubuntu

We are seeing occasional rackspace apt mirror failures, to work around
this in case of a failure swap mirror with anl.gov.
Use anl.gov because it is in the US, has a 10GB network and is usually
up to date.

This workaround is needed because apt-get doesn't know how to gracefully
recover if the primary source vanishes.

This is for testing only a proper solution belongs in devstack-gate.
devstack-gate can run an apt-get update before entering devstack and run
this action if apt-get update has issues.

Testing what happens with a mirror that will return 404 errors.

Change-Id: I5e9fc1edab8f6531285b3ea02641aec9470cad4d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/60/107060/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add a secondary repo URL, so if the primary one fails we have a backup sudo apt-add-repository 'http://mirror.anl.gov/pub/ubuntu/ main'

commit_message:
Enable event storing

Event storing is disabled by default, although
it's needed for the event scenario testing, 
so this change fixes it.

blueprint add-ceilometer-scenario-tests

Change-Id: I1cb687b43ef7279afce12fd687b25175e3ff1bb9

commit_message:
Synchronize $DATA_DIR and $SERVICE_DIR with $DEST in stackrc

If only $DEST is specified and $DATA_DIR (also $SERVICE_DIR)
is not specified in "local.conf", after having been sourced,
the variables $DEST and $DATA_DIR (also $SERVICE_DIR) are no
longer synchronized.

Change-Id: Ie9b2777bbd6cd5d99ac51560b83a85ecc54fb188
Closes-bug: #1387934
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/55/132155/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ensure that $DATA_DIR is synchronized with $DEST DATA_DIR=${DEST}/data

commit_message:
Permit non-loopback guest access to Rabbit

Recent versions of RabbitMQ have defaulted to only permitting the
guest user to access over a loopback interface. To allow the guest
user to connect from a remote host set the loopback_users
configuration as shown in http://www.rabbitmq.com/access-control.html

Change-Id: Ie0dd4167399cc9a94624da4948bb7816b6b9ef90
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/89/128389/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # recent versions of RabbitMQ have defaulted to only permitting # the guest user to connect through loopback # see www.rabbitmq.com/access-control.html fix_it=true if [[ -e /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config ]]; then if grep -q 'rabbit, .*loopback_users, \[\]' /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config; then fix_it=false fi fi if $fix_it; then echo '[{rabbit, [{loopback_users, []}]}].' | sudo tee -a /etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.config # if the service was already running restart it if ps ax | grep -v grep | grep rabbitmq-server > /dev/null; then sudo service rabbitmq-server restart fi fi

commit_message:
Update rally job files

Rename rally-scenarios/ to rally-jobs/ Because it makes much more sense
to call directory with jobs files rally-jobs

Add pretty README files, that describes how to write plugins and use
extra dir

Update main README.rst file that describes what the hell is this=)

Add cinder-fakevirt.yaml that will be required after this infra patch
is merged: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135137/

Change-Id: Ic7e5e8a99fc1385638fb187a04475a42eedcfeb2

commit_message:
Kill xtrabackup spawned processes

* Send KILL signals to all processed spawned by mysqld
* Refactor OCF script to make it more simple and more understandable

Closes-Bug: 1388779

Change-Id: Ie3f6149d3f97f5e8cf3f1f3329b9e335e551b3e6
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/05/137105/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MYSQL_BINDIR="$(dirname ${OCF_RESKEY_binary})"HOSTNAME="$(uname -n)" NODES="$(crm_node --partition)" NODES="$(crm_node --list | awk '/^[a-zA-Z0-9]/ {print $2}')" if [ $rc -eq $OCF_SUCCESS ]; then if [ $GTID -ne 0 ]; then if [ $PARTITION_WITH_QUORUM -eq 1 -o $NODE_COUNT -eq 1 ]; then if [ $rc -eq 0 -a $RUNNING_INSTANCES -lt 1 ]; then if [ "$MASTER_GTID" = "${TMP[$NODE]}" ]; then local NODES local timeout=$(get_master_timeout) ocf_log info "Checking if Primary Controller" NODES=$(nodes_in_cluster_online) if [ "$MASTER" = "$HOSTNAME" ]; then while [ $timeout -gt 0 ]; do ocf_log info "${HOSTNAME} is not Primary Component" sleep $sleeptime (( timeout -= 10 )) ocf_log info "Waiting for master. ${timeout} seconds left" if [ "$MASTER" = "$HOSTNAME" ]; then ocf_log info "${HOSTNAME} is not Primary Component" if [ -e $OCF_RESKEY_pid ]; then sleep $sleeptime (( i-- )) ocf_log info "PIDFile ${OCF_RESKEY_pid} of MySQL server not found. Sleeping for $sleeptime seconds. $(( i-1 )) retries left" pid=$(cat $OCF_RESKEY_pid); if [ $? -eq $OCF_SUCCESS ]; then check_if_galera_pc if [ $rc -ne 0 ]; then mysql_status info 1 if [ $rc -eq $OCF_SUCCESS ]; then elif [ $rc -ne $OCF_NOT_RUNNING ]; then local pid=$(cat $OCF_RESKEY_pid 2> /dev/null) local mysql_user=$(ps --no-headers -ouser= ${pid}) ocf_log info "Sending SIGTERM to PID: ${pid}" if [ $rc -ne $OCF_SUCCESS ]; then shutdown_timeout=20 while [ $shutdown_timeout -gt 0 ]; do if [ $rc -eq $OCF_NOT_RUNNING ]; then (( shutdown_timeout-- )) ocf_log info "MySQL still hasn't stopped yet. ${shutdown_timeout} left " if [ $? -ne $OCF_NOT_RUNNING ]; then ocf_log info "MySQL failed to stop using SIGTERM. Sending SIGKILL to PID: ${pid}" # Cleaning of resources spawned by xtrabackup # Due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/percona-xtradb-cluster/+bug/1380697 local mysql_pids=$(ps -o pid= -U ${mysql_user} 2> /dev/null|tr '\n' ' ') if [ ! -z "$mysql_pids" ]; then ocf_log info "Killing processes running under ${mysql_user} user" /bin/kill -KILL ${mysql_pids} > /dev/null 2>&1 fi
deleted_lines: HOSTOS=`uname`MYSQL_BINDIR=`dirname ${OCF_RESKEY_binary}`HOSTNAME=`uname -n` NODES=$(crm_node --partition) NODES=$(crm_node --list | awk '/^[a-zA-Z0-9]/ {print $2}') if [ $rc -eq 0 ]; then if [ "$GTID" != 0 ]; then if [ "$PARTITION_WITH_QUORUM" -eq 1 -o "$NODE_COUNT" -eq 1 ]; then if [ $rc -eq 0 -a "$RUNNING_INSTANCES" -lt 1 ]; then if [ "$MASTER_GTID" -eq ${TMP[$NODE]} ]; then local NODES=$1 local last_timeout=$(get_master_timeout) local timeout=$last_timeout local sleeptime=30 ocf_log info "Checking if galera primary controller" if [ "$MASTER" == "$HOSTNAME" ]; then while [ "$timeout" -gt 0 ]; do sleep $sleeptime ocf_log info "Waiting for master. $timeout seconds to go" if [ $last_timeout -ne $(get_master_timeout) ]; then last_timeout=$(get_master_timeout) timeout=$last_timeout else timeout=$(($timeout-$sleeptime)) fi if [ "$MASTER" == "$HOSTNAME" ]; then if [ ! -e $OCF_RESKEY_pid ]; then ocf_log info "PIDFile ${OCF_RESKEY_pid} of MySQL server not found. Sleeping for $sleeptime seconds. $(( i-1 )) retries left" sleep $sleeptime else let i=$i-1 pid=`cat $OCF_RESKEY_pid`; if [ $? = $OCF_SUCCESS ]; then NODES=$(nodes_in_cluster) check_if_galera_pc "$NODES" if [ $rc != 0 ]; then mysql_status info if [ $rc = $OCF_SUCCESS ]; then elif [ $rc != $OCF_NOT_RUNNING ]; then pid=`cat $OCF_RESKEY_pid 2> /dev/null ` if [ $rc != 0 ]; then shutdown_timeout=15 count=0 while [ $count -lt $shutdown_timeout ] do if [ $rc = $OCF_NOT_RUNNING ]; then count=`expr $count + 1` ocf_log debug "MySQL still hasn't stopped yet. Waiting..." if [ $? != $OCF_NOT_RUNNING ]; then ocf_log info "MySQL failed to stop after ${shutdown_timeout}s using SIGTERM. Trying SIGKILL..." ocf_log info "MySQL stopped";

commit_message:
Remove stable compatibility jobs from capped libs

We are introducing version caps on libraries in stable branches, so we
no longer need to test updates to their master branches against the
stable branches of applications.

Change-Id: I2d5697871d5750f37399b5b60a92297cbf69d6b5

subject: Do additional checks in OCF only for action monitor.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-04 13:47:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/17c1ca5f6955e27e5a4d5080a04ef0067665ee7d', 'message': 'Do additional checks in OCF only for action monitor.

W/o this change, the *monitor() function of OCF scripts
do additional AMQP connection checks unconditionally, every
time it has been invoked. And that could cause *too much* netstat
invocations for host OS to handle them w/o an issues.

By design, we want these additional checks performed only when
OCF script being invoked as a monitor action, but not as a start
or stop, for example.

The solution is to check $__OCF_ACTION inside of monitor() function
and act as appropriate. Also, a sleep 1 for action start loop should
be as well aligned with the other ones in other OCF scripts and it
should be 3 seconds instead.

Closes-bug: #1385755

Change-Id: I4eba9fd5e3eaa6448590808ea85bdf152b2ef176
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

Closes-bug: #1385755

Change-Id: I4eba9fd5e3eaa6448590808ea85bdf152b2ef176
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-05 09:15:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/4881b3d25318b465a23771e23ce10b3dbfe3fce5', 'message': 'Do additional checks in OCF only for action monitor.

W/o this change, the *monitor() function of OCF scripts

invocations for host OS to handle them w/o an issues.

By design, we want these additional checks performed only when
OCF script being invoked as a monitor action, but not as a start
or stop, for example.

The solution is:
* check if $__OCF_ACTION = monitor and do AMQP checks only then.
* align sleep (3 sec) for action start loop amongst all of the OCF scripts

commit_message:
Do additional checks in OCF only for action monitor.

W/o this change, the *monitor() function of OCF scripts
do additional AMQP connection checks unconditionally, every
time it has been invoked. And that could cause *too much* netstat
invocations for host OS to handle them w/o an issues.

By design, we want these additional checks performed only when
OCF script being invoked as a monitor action, but not as a start
or stop, for example.

The solution is:
* check if $__OCF_ACTION = monitor and do AMQP checks only then.
* align sleep (3 sec) for action start loop amongst all of the OCF scripts
* replace netstat to lsof tool due to /proc FS based approach
  for sockets parsing fits better for high loaded systems with
  many connections. Also, 'lsof -p $pid' will not search for all
  of the existing sockets - which could be tens of housands -
  but only for ones from /proc/$pid/ instead, that is very fast and
  provides no additional load for host OS.

Closes-bug: #1385755

Change-Id: I4eba9fd5e3eaa6448590808ea85bdf152b2ef176
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/53/139053/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check the connections according to the PID, if has been invoked as a monitor action. if [ "${__OCF_ACTION}" = "monitor" ]; then # We are sure to hit the scheduler process and not other Neutron process with the same connection behavior (for example neutron-server) pid=`get_worker_pid` # check the connections according to the PID network_amqp_check=`netstat -punt | grep -s "$OCF_RESKEY_amqp_server_port" | grep -s "$pid" | grep -qs "ESTABLISHED"` rc=$? if [ $rc -ne 0 ]; then ocf_log err "Neutron DHCP Agent is not connected to the AMQP server : $rc" return $OCF_NOT_RUNNING fi
deleted_lines: # Check the connections according to the PID. # We are sure to hit the scheduler process and not other Neutron process with the same connection behavior (for example neutron-server) pid=`get_worker_pid` # check the connections according to the PID network_amqp_check=`netstat -punt | grep -s "$OCF_RESKEY_amqp_server_port" | grep -s "$pid" | grep -qs "ESTABLISHED"` rc=$? if [ $rc -ne 0 ]; then ocf_log err "Neutron DHCP Agent is not connected to the AMQP server : $rc" return $OCF_NOT_RUNNING

commit_message:
Fix MySQL destructive test

* I7f50e32ced83af8f32fd7907cb5fc723055da121 separated pid directories for
  Pacemaker managed resources moving PID files to $HA_RSCTMP/$__SCRIPT_NAME
  This patch changes test to use name rather than PID
* Change pkill to to pkill -x to kill mysqld rathar than all processes
  that match mysqld pattern

Closes-Bug: 1399605
Related-Bug: 1388779
Change-Id: I34d540200f0ce2ff17b30e20a43f4d13c86b7492
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/96/139596/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: check_cmd = 'pkill -0 -x mysqld')
deleted_lines: if OPENSTACK_RELEASE_UBUNTU in OPENSTACK_RELEASE: mysql_pidfile = '/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.pid' else: mysql_pidfile = '/var/run/mysql/mysqld.pid' check_cmd = '[ -r {0} ] && pkill -0 -F {0}'.format(mysql_pidfile)

subject: Override retry_interval in MongoAutoReconnectTest
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-08 15:58:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/7c1e6d72456c97016ca67a73a8225499a916584b', 'message': 'Override retry_interval in MongoAutoReconnectTest

Currently, retry_interval is only override when class definition,
that will not work for all unit test cases (only one will work if
we are lucky). This patch fixes this issue by putting it to setUp
method.

Note, retry_interval is 0 can still work for retry algorithm, we
can reduce the time cost to minimum.

commit_message:
Override retry_interval in MongoAutoReconnectTest

Currently, retry_interval is only override when class definition,
that will not work for all unit test cases. This patch fixes this
issue by putting it to setUp method.

Note, retry_interval is 0 can still work for retry algorithm, we
can reduce the time cost to minimum.

Note, DB2 uses same code as MongoDB for connecting, so if MongoDB
works, so can DB2. But they are different in many ways, and this
patch only aims at improving the unit test speed, so DB2 test can
be discussed and added in another patch.

Change-Id: I3e5e15b6d2f503ad7fb81875470259508eff988c
Closes-Bug: #1390680

commit_message:
Wait for hypervisor-stats to reflect ironic nodes

When enrolling nodes into Ironic, poll nova's hypervisor-stats until
the hypervisor count reflects the number of enrolled nodes.  This
eliminates a race where devstack completes and an instance is spawned
before the first post-enrollment periodic task ticks on the Nova side,
which has recently started popping up in the gate.

Conflicts:
	lib/ironic

Change-Id: Ib3d8005e0094ee8af2d5fcb65aca6cd92736da90
Closes-bug: #1398128
(cherry picked from commit c78e4671098f08c2eaf0b033777d3c01082141cd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/64/138164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function wait_for_nova_resources { # After nodes have been enrolled, we need to wait for n-cpu's periodic # task populate the resource tracker with available nodes. Wait for 2 # minutes before timing out. expected_count=$1 echo_summary "Waiting 2 minutes for Nova resource tracker to pick up $expected_count Ironic nodes" for i in `seq 1 120` ; do if [ $(nova hypervisor-stats | grep " count " | get_field 2) -ge $expected_count ]; then return 0 fi sleep 1 done die $LINENO "Nova hypervisor-stats did not register at least $expected_count nodes" } local total_nodes=0 total_nodes=$((total_nodes+1)) if [ "$VIRT_DRIVER" == "ironic" ]; then wait_for_nova_resources $total_nodes fi

commit_message:
object-ify flavors manager side of the RPC

This change completes the conversion of flavors to use objects instead
of direct database access. The rpcapi sends objects for the new version
and primitivized data is sent for older versions.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: Ib876f276cff99a21c5bca1c9f062a6c221a783e8

commit_message:
VMware: add default image metadata for hw_vif_model

During glance image-create we are currently setting a null value
for the hw_vif_model, if we are unable to introspect from the vmdk
file.

This patch adds a default value if not found.

Change-Id: I6d0f551b18f03e2a799ae14c3347652a285693f0

commit_message:
VMware: ephemeral disk support

This patch ensures that the driver honors the following for
ephemeral disks:
 1. the flavor definition
 2. the block device mappings

The driver will now create an ephemeral disk(s) if necessary.

The ephemeral disks will be of a 'thin' disk type.

Closes-bug: #1369254

This is part of blueprint vmware-ephemeral-disk-support

DocImpact
  - Indicate that ephemeral disks are now supported by the driver

Change-Id: Icb1796e58126a1e03613946b0f5a917d6eb4708e
